intro: Oxygonum somalense var. trichocarpum, commonly known as the Somali oxygonum, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It is adapted to survive in dry environments, storing water in its thick stems. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native habitat.
